## Post with Code

Welcome to RainbowR blog post! You have a blog post idea that has LGBTQ data and want the community to see it? Here is now the data will look on this blog within the RainbowR theme.

For this demo post, we will show what Star Wars data looks like.

```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(thematic)
library(bslib)
library(showtext)

font_add_google('Lato','Lato')
showtext_auto()

rainbow_theme = function(){
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = 'Lato', size = 12),
    panel.grid.major = element_line(colour = "#7700b3"),
    panel.grid.minor = element_line(colour = "#7700b3"),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "#1A0933"),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#1A0933"),
    
    axis.line = element_line(colour = "white"),
    axis.ticks = element_line(colour = "white"),

    axis.title = element_text(colour = "white"),
    axis.text = element_text(colour = "ghostwhite"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(colour = "white"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(colour = "white"),
    
    legend.text = element_text(colour = "white"),
    legend.title = element_text(colour = "white"),
    legend.background = element_rect(fill = NA)
  )
  
}

```

## Star Wars

Let us look at Star Wars inside a blog

```{r, dpi=300, width=10, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(paletteer)
starwars = starwars

ggplot(
  starwars,
  aes(x= height, y= eye_color, color=height)
)+
  geom_point(size= 2)+
  scale_color_paletteer_c(`"ggthemes::Orange"`)+
  rainbow_theme()
```

This ggplot shows Star Wars height vs eye color of the characters, the `geom_point()` colors really work well with oranges against the purple background.
